imdb.title: Psycho-Pass
imdb.plot: Believing in humanity and order, policewoman Akane Tsunemori obeys the ruling, computerized, precognitive Sibyl System. But when she faces a criminal mastermind who can elude this perfect system, she questions both Sibyl and herself.

episodes.title: Laelaps' Calling
episodes.plot: Tokyo, 2120. A massive transport drone crashes, and Unit One's new inspectors Arata Shindo and Kei Mikhail Ignatov head to investigate. Discovering that Hyper Transport Co. accountant Asahi Rick Fellows is missing, Arata performs a Mental Trace to track him, but finds only his waterlogged corpse. Arata and Kei suspect the crash was staged, and pursue the mastermind who tried to silence Rick.

episodes.title: Teumessian Sacrifices
episodes.plot: Unit One chases a suspect in the staged crash, Hyper Transport Co. executive Takumi Yonehara, into an abandoned zone. But when they track Yonehara down, they find he's already dead. Arata and Kei ignore Chief Shimotsuki's orders and pursue the mastermind, Sasagawa, to Ariake Airport, where two unfamiliar men stand in their way: Shinya Kogami and Nobuchika Ginoza of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

episodes.title: Herakles and the Sirens
episodes.plot: After meeting Karina Komiya face-to-face, Arata senses something unfathomable from her, but can't find a clue to the case. Then Lee Aki, the secretary of her opponent, Kosuke "Heracles" Yakushiji, is murdered. Unit One decides to split up to investigate both the attackers and their victims, but.

episodes.title: Political Strife in the Colosseum
episodes.plot: Freelance journalist Yayoi Kunizuka joins Unit One as an investigation consultant to fill the gap left by Kei's suspension. As the investigation progresses, Unit One uncovers Karina Komiya's greatest secret. Guessing that Karina will be the next to be attacked, they rush to her gubernatorial debate at the Giga Arena.

episodes.title: Agamemnon's Offering
episodes.plot: A Special Religious Zone is established, where immigrants can practice religion freely. Religious leaders gather for a press event in Mitake New Town, the site of the Special Zone.

episodes.title: Caesar's Gold Coins
episodes.plot: Arata and the others have just learned that there are three more human bombs when a third suicide bombing in New Town's factory district takes Joseph Auma's life.

episodes.title: Don't Take God's Name in Vain
episodes.plot: Arata learns that Kurisu is still alive and the one secretly behind the terrorist bombings. Meanwhile, Shimotsuki arranges a raid on Heavens' Leap to rescue the captured Mao and Kei.

episodes.title: Cubism
episodes.plot: Mao confesses a secret to Kei as Unit One gets closer to the truth behind everything that has happened and the mysterious foxes behind the scenes.

episodes.title: The Scales of Justice (299/300)
episodes.plot: Some time after the events of Season 1, inspector Tsunemori, now the senior inspector in her old team, commands several new inspectors and enforcers. A disturbing series of bombings becomes their baptism of fire.

episodes.title: The Creeping Unknown
episodes.plot: The bomber is captured, but his high crime coefficient becomes normal again, which should be impossible. Inspector Tsunemori discovers letters "WC" scratched on her window. Inspector Shisui and her gun are missing.

episodes.title: The Devil's Proof
episodes.plot: Inspector Tsunemori starts to believe that the missing inspector has been kidnapped by a person who can't be read by the psycho-scanners. Since this should be impossible, she asks Jouji Saiga, who's now locked up, for help.

episodes.title: The Salvation of Job
episodes.plot: An agile murderous psychotic elderly man has trapped Inspector Aoyanagi and several patients. His Crime Coefficient somehow remains clear no matter how brutal he becomes, so she can't use her Dominator. She becomes the bait for the MWPSB.

episodes.title: Unforbidden Games
episodes.plot: A man known as Kamui brainwashes Inspector Shisui and is able to wield her Dominator. The other inspectors close in on his suspected position, but it's just another deadly trap. Hacked sentry mechs from a nearby factory target them.

episodes.title: Those Who Cast Stones
episodes.plot: The hack made the mechs controllable by unsuspecting citizens who think they're playing their favorite handheld game. If the inspectors shut down the system, mass hysteria and rise in Crime Coefficients are inevitable.

episodes.title: Untraceable Children
episodes.plot: Inspector Tsunemori and her team finally piece together who Kamui actually is. However, several important questions remain. For instance, why Sybil won't deactivate the stolen Dominators?

episodes.title: Conception of the Oracle <AA>
episodes.plot: The team apprehends the doctor who operated on Kamui as a child and learn more information about Kamui's motivations. Meanwhile, Inspector Mika, who hates Inspector Tsunemori, finds out on her own more than she bargained for.

episodes.title: Omnipotence Paradox
episodes.plot: Sinister chief Kasei and sadistic enforcer Togane tell nosy Inspector Mika all about Sybil and make her their pawn. Meanwhile, Inspector Tsunemori's team tracks down a person who might be helping Kamui.

episodes.title: Gauging the Soul
episodes.plot: Kamui makes his final move, so chief Kasei orders Inspector Tsunemori to kill him and sends enforcer Togane to force her to do it by any means necessary. Inspector Tsunemori is about to found out what color she truly is.

episodes.title: What Color?
episodes.plot: Inspector Tsunemori makes her choice. Now it's Sybil's turn to make a choice.

episodes.title: Hanzai Keisuu
episodes.plot: Inspector Akane Tsunemori takes on her first case, which involves a man who kidnaps a woman and holds her hostage.

episodes.title: Nashi Uru Mono
episodes.plot: Recuperating from Akane's Paralyzer shot and the fallout from her first case, Kogami worries she's not inspector material.

episodes.title: Shiiku no sahou
episodes.plot: Ginoza, Akane and the Enforcers investigate a suspicious death at a drone manufacturing plant.

episodes.title: Dare mo Shiranai Anata no Kamen
episodes.plot: When the CID investigates Kimihiko Hayama's disappearance, they not only discover that he's been killed, but someone has taken over his net avatar.

episodes.title: Dare mo Shiranai Anata no Kao
episodes.plot: The CID's hunt for Kimihiko Hayama's killer leads them to another murder with the same modus operandi. Now it's up to the CID to figure out how to track down the killer's real identity and get justice for the victims.

episodes.title: Return of the Psychotic Prince
episodes.plot: Akane wants to learn more about Kogami's past and why he's an Enforcer, while CID detectives investigate the Hachioji Drone incident.

episodes.title: Symbolism of Bletilla Striata
episodes.plot: Ginoza realizes that the recent murders and the Specimen Case are related, and only one piece of evidence exists: a blurry image of Makishima.

episodes.title: And Then, Silence
episodes.plot: Kogami determines that the girls' school killer isn't the same murderer from the years-old unsolved case, but is actually one of the students.

episodes.title: Rakuen no Kajitsu
episodes.plot: While attempting to track down Makishima, Kogami takes Tsunemori to his former teacher for a crash course on criminal profiling.

episodes.title: Metosura no Yuugi
episodes.plot: Makishima and Senguji attempt to trap Kogami in an abandoned subway station using Akane's friend Yuki as bait, but all doesn't go as planned.

episodes.title: The Saint's Supper
episodes.plot: Akane goes after Makishima alone after he captures her friend Yuki - but, to her shock, Akane finds that her weapon is useless against him.

episodes.title: Devil's Crossroad
episodes.plot: In an episode taking place three years prior to the beginning of the series, guitarist and latent criminal Yayoi is enlisted by then-Inspector Kogami.

episodes.title: Invitation from the Abyss
episodes.plot: The head of the Public Security Bureau, Joshu Kasei, orders Ginoza to capture Makishima, despite him being "criminally asymptomatic".

episodes.title: Sweet Poison
episodes.plot: A series of crimes are committed by people wearing helmets that copy the low Crime Coefficients of innocent bystanders.

episodes.title: The Town Where Sulfur Falls
episodes.plot: Footage of the helmet-wearing criminals goes viral, prompting the public to respond with violence, and soon, riots break out.

episodes.title: The Gates of Judgment
episodes.plot: Akane, Kogami and Shusei trap Makishima in the Nona Tower, resulting in a battle that tests Akane's control over her emotions.

episodes.title: Iron Guts
episodes.plot: After Makishima is arrested and the riots are controlled, Kogami's interest turns to how Makishima will be judged, as well as Shusei's whereabouts.

episodes.title: Promises Written in Water
episodes.plot: When Kasei takes Kogami off the Makishima case, Kogami suspects there is something more to it than just routine.

episodes.title: Transparent Shadows
episodes.plot: Ginoza, whose Hue is now a problem, refuses therapy so he can retrieve Kogami and Makishima, who intends to attack Japan's food supply.

episodes.title: Where Justice Is Found
episodes.plot: Akane contacts the Sibyl System and asks it to withdraw the execution order for Kogami if she accomplishes its request to capture Makishima alive.

episodes.title: Blood-Stained Reward
episodes.plot: As Makishima works on reprogramming the virus, Kogami and Akane arrive at the factory to stop him, which proves harder than they thought.

episodes.title: A Perfect World
episodes.plot: The series heads to a conclusion as Kogami and Makishima are locked in mortal combat, while Akane tries to stop Kogami from killing Makishima in order to save Kogami's life and uphold the law.
